{"answer": "E", "reasoning": "Let me analyze each statement:

i. Eidgenössische, kantonale und kommunale Steuern können von Selbständigerwerbenden und juristischen Personen als geschäftsmässig begründeter Aufwand geltend gemacht werden. - This is CORRECT. Taxes are deductible as business expenses for both self-employed individuals and legal entities.

ii. Die Ausgabe von Gratisaktien unterliegt der Emissionsabgabe, auch wenn diese aus Kapitaleinlagereserven gebildet werden. - This is FALSE. Under the Kapitaleinlageprinzip (capital contribution principle), gratisaktien formed from capital contribution reserves (Kapitaleinlagereserven) are exempt from the Emissionsabgabe (issuance stamp duty). Art. 6 Abs. 1 lit. h StG provides an exemption.

iii. Gemäss dem dualistischen System unterliegen Gewinne aus der Veräusserung von Grundstücken stets der Grundstückgewinnsteuer und der Einkommens- bzw. Gewinnsteuer. - This is FALSE... wait. In the dualistic system, private real estate gains are subject to Grundstückgewinnsteuer, while business real estate gains are subject to Einkommens-/Gewinnsteuer (not both). Actually, in the dualistic system, business property gains are taxed under income/profit tax only, and private property gains under Grundstückgewinnsteuer only - they are NOT subject to BOTH taxes simultaneously. The statement says 'stets der Grundstückgewinnsteuer UND der Einkommens- bzw. Gewinnsteuer' which would mean always both - that's wrong. But wait, re-reading: it says 'der Grundstückgewinnsteuer und der Einkommens- bzw. Gewinnsteuer' - this could mean they are subject to one OR the other. Actually 'stets... und' means always both, which is incorrect. But actually in the monistic system, all real estate gains go to Grundstückgewinnsteuer. In the dualistic system, business gains go to income tax and private gains to Grundstückgewinnsteuer - so NOT both. Hmm, but the statement says 'stets der GGSt und der ESt/GSt' - this is clearly wrong for the dualistic system. However, let me reconsider - is this really false? Actually no, this IS false because in the dualistic system gains are subject to EITHER one or the other, not both.

Wait, but let me reconsider option E (ii and v) vs P (ii and iii).

iv. Privilegierte Warenreserve requires booking in Handelsbilanz - This is CORRECT due to the Massgeblichkeitsprinzip. Tax-recognized provisions must be reflected in the commercial balance sheet.

v. Bei der Zuordnung eines Vermögenswertes zum Geschäfts- oder Privatvermögen zu einer Kommanditgesellschaft haben sachenrechtliche Eigentumsverhältnisse eine herausragende Bedeutung. - This is FALSE. For partnerships (Kommanditgesellschaft), the functional/economic use of the asset is decisive (Präponderanzmethode), not the property law ownership (sachenrechtliche Eigentumsverhältnisse).

iii - Re-reading more carefully: 'stets der Grundstückgewinnsteuer und der Einkommens- bzw. Gewinnsteuer' - In the dualistic system, gains are subject to either GGSt (private) or ESt/GSt (business), not both simultaneously. So statement iii is indeed false.

But looking at the options, there's no option for ii, iii, and v. Let me recheck iii. Actually, maybe iii is describing the dualistic system incorrectly on purpose. In the dualistic system, real estate gains from business property are subject to income/profit tax only, while private property gains are subject to Grundstückgewinnsteuer only. The word 'stets' (always) combined with 'und' (and) makes this false.

Hmm, but option E is ii and v, and option P is ii and iii. There's no ii, iii, v option.

Actually, re-reading iii: maybe 'und' here means 'or' in a listing sense, or it could be read as 'der Grundstückgewinnsteuer und [alternatively] der Einkommens- bzw. Gewinnsteuer' - meaning they always fall under one of these two taxes. That reading would make iii correct.

With that reading, the false statements are ii and v → Answer E."}
